Explanation: The Fourier transform \\( \\hat{g}(\\omega) \\) fundamentally alters the characteristics of the original function in the frequency domain. When transformed back, while theoretically an inverse Fourier transform should recover the original function, any practical application or numeric computation might introduce discrepancies, particularly under different system parameters like damping factor b.
